article.headline: North Carolina Greensboro 67, Chattanooga 57
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. (AP) -- Freshman Kendall Toney led all scorers with 17 points and Kyle Hines added 16 points and eight rebounds to lift UNC Greensboro past Chattanooga 67-57 on Saturday. Toney made five 3-pointers for the Spartans (8-9, 5-2 Southern Conference). Ricky Hickman added 12 points and Mikko Koivisto posted 11. Marcus Watts scored 11 points to lead Chattanooga (8-11, 1-6). Nicchaeus Doaks and Casey Long each scored 10 points. The Spartans led 31-29 at the half. Chattanooga rallied in the final minutes of the second half to trim a 10-point deficit to 5 with just under four minutes left. Dwayne Johnson hit a 3-pointer from the top of the key to give the Spartans an eight-point lead. UNC Greensboro then hit 4-of-4 at the line to put the game out of reach.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
